Item.sqlserver_body: /* Name: select_activity_value Purpose: This must handle every value which is contained in the list with name = "datelist" Note: @NOW passed in as an argument, because GETUTCDATE() is non-deterministic and cannot be used inside a user-defined-function. TODO: dynamically generate this SQL based on, or when the admin changes the datelist values. Or it could be based on a query if the Property table, which this is, from a database with VersionBuild=5237 Created: 3-DEC-2005 George J. Carrette */ CREATE FUNCTION innovator.Select_activity_value(@ID CHAR(32), @COL VARCHAR(32), @NOW DATETIME) RETURNS TABLE AS RETURN -- This is a linear search. But we could use operators "<" and ">" and -- code a binary search, amenable to compiler-generated code. SELECT VALUE = CASE WHEN @COL = 'today' THEN @NOW WHEN @COL = 'created_on' THEN (SELECT created_on FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_activated' THEN (SELECT date_activated FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_due_act' THEN (SELECT date_due_act FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_due_original' THEN (SELECT date_due_original FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_due_sched' THEN (SELECT date_due_sched FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_ef' THEN (SELECT date_ef FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_es' THEN (SELECT date_es FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_lf' THEN (SELECT date_lf FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_ls' THEN (SELECT date_ls FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_start_act' THEN (SELECT date_start_act FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_start_sched' THEN (SELECT date_start_sched FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'date_user_estimate' THEN (SELECT date_user_estimate FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) WHEN @COL = 'modified_on' THEN (SELECT modified_on FROM ACTIVITY2 WHERE ID = @ID) ELSE NULL END
Item.name: select_activity_value
